Ah, a house plan. A classic. Trouble with scale in LibreOffice Draw, you say? I can help with that. The most common pitfall is not setting the drawing page scale first. You need to tell Draw what one unit on your drawing represents in the real world before you start drawing anything. Otherwise, it's just a bunch of lines with no true meaning, isn't it?
Here's the direct approach, Buddy Boy.
First, you need to set up the page scale itself:
Go to Format > Page... in the menu.
In the Page Setup dialog, navigate to the Scale tab.
Set the Drawing scale. For example, to make 1 cm on your drawing equal to 1 meter in reality, you would set '1 cm' to '1 m'.
Click OK.
Once that's done, you'll find that all the measurements you enter or see in the drawing will be automatically converted based on this scale. It's much simpler than trying to do the math yourself.
If you're having trouble with objects not resizing correctly after the scale is set, double-check that you're using the 'Dimension Lines' tool for measurements, as it will automatically display the real-world distance. Let me know if that's not the issue, and we'll dig a little deeper.
